summary: Tested i18n/translations feature: Backend API endpoints and Frontend language switcher across all portals (Admin, Technician, Customer, Login). All features working correctly.
context_for_next_testing_agent: i18n feature is fully functional. Backend serves translations from JSON files. Frontend uses React Context for translations. Language preference persists in localStorage.

backend_translations_api_get_lang.notes: GET /api/translations/{lang} returns correct JSON data for both 'en' and 'lt'

backend_translations_fallback.notes: Non-existent language codes fall back to English translations

frontend_login_page_language_switcher.notes: Language switcher visible on Login page with globe icon. Dropdown shows English and Lietuvių options.

frontend_admin_navigation_language_switc.notes: Language switcher in Admin navigation header. All nav items change (Dashboard→Pradžia, Products→Produktai, etc.)

frontend_technician_navigation_language_.notes: Language switcher in Technician navigation header. Portal title changes (Technician Portal→Techniko portalas)

frontend_customer_navigation_language_sw.notes: Language switcher in Customer navigation header. Portal title changes (Customer Portal→Kliento portalas)

language_switching_updates_ui.notes: Switching from English to Lithuanian updates all UI text dynamically without page reload

language_persistence_localstorage.notes: Language preference persists after page refresh via localStorage key 'dimeda_language'

login_forms_translated.notes: Login form labels change (Password→Slaptažodis), buttons change (Login as Admin→Prisijungti kaip administratorius)
